page.title: 18YOUNG PEOPLE DURING 20TH C
page.content: Several old people in Ixworth Court Old People's home were asked how their childhood differed from the children of 1985. The main difference noted was the simplicity of a child's life at the beginning of this century compared with today. Children used to be expected to work for the family-feeding hens,stone picking,gleaning,collecting wood for the fire,cleaning boots and looking after younger siblings. Today children are asked to do less around the home. They have different expectations. They attend clubs for sport, Youth organisations such as scouts,guides, army cadets or a youth club, they have hobbies and watch a lot of television. The old people used to only visit Bury St.Edmunds about twice a year by horse and cart(After harvest and at Christmas for market), now children go by bus or car at least weekly.
